title: Director, Strategy
content:
Director, Creative Strategy

About Us

Virgo Health works for pharmaceutical, biotech, and device companies to inform and educate healthcare professionals about the latest developments in clinical research and therapeutic approaches. 
We leverage our meetings, digital, and interactive expertise to understand what’s easy and relevant for healthcare professionals to engage with. We tailor our content and design it to offer choice and active participation. 
Real, relevant, and human.

Job Overview
We are looking for an exceptional Director of Creative Strategy with a passion for creativity and clarity. Your role will focus on establishing the creative direction that ensures our healthcare clients achieve their business goals. Through your work, you will demonstrate strategic expertise, breakthrough insights, and implementable plans that align with client goals and associated budgets. 
Internally, you will help drive the strategic evolution of Virgo Health. You will monitor and share intelligence regarding cultural, marketing, and digital trends. Your counsel will inspire the innovative thinking needed to keep us executing leading edge solutions for our clients.
We are seeking a curious, highly motivated self-starter who can deconstruct and analyze client challenges to generate the insights that unlock powerful creative solutions. We want people who love presenting their own work and are willing to collaborate with others to hone it to perfection. 
Our ideal candidate will have advanced knowledge of industry standard software and tools including the full suite Microsoft office. Familiarity with the big three Adobe apps (Id, Ai & Ps) is a bonus.
A minimum of 7 years in a fast-paced studio environment is desirable, as is the ability to work from your own initiative along with excellent time management. Experience of working with healthcare clients is a must. A strong portfolio demonstrating your skills as a strategic thinker and communicator will be a requirement for consideration.
Core Responsibilities
·       Maintaining excellent client relationships & understanding of clients' key business and challenges
·       Provide analysis, insights, and counsel for program planning and new business opportunities 
·       Identify, develop and oversee the delivery of unique and innovative strategies to deliver against client objectives
·       Produce executable, relevant plans for a wide range of media and platforms, especially in-person, video, social and digital experiences
·       Build KPI frameworks to underpin and measure the success of program implementation
·       Generate intelligence regarding healthcare, cultural, consumer and market trends to promote continual internal innovation
·       Support sell in of ideas with client-ready presentations
·       Feed into creative briefs alongside the creative and client leads 
·       Work in concert with a wide range of departments including client services, scientific, creative, design, digital and motion 
·       Work effectively with external vendors and internal colleagues to complete projects within timeframe and budget
Experience/Skills Required
·       Outstanding research and analytical skills 
·       Strategic insight and sensitivity to trends in healthcare, popular culture, and design
·       Focus on producing actionable plans that deliver against client objectives
·       Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
·       Great presentation skills
·       Ability to prioritize and work within tight timeframes
·       Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office (Powerpoint, Word, Excel)
·       Familiarity with Adobe CS (InDesign, Photoshop, and Illustrator)
·       Highly motivated to work from own initiative
·       Attention to detail
·       Organized and logical
·       Confident and proactive
·       Adaptable

Level of Experience
Minimum 7 years of studio/agency/in-house experience
Qualification
Diploma or degree in scientific, creative, or related subject
Virgo Characteristics


·       Team player
·       Reliable
·       Enthusiastic
·       Conscientious
·       Proactive
·       Self-motivated
·       Multitasker
·       Organized
·       Detail focused.

Key Performance Indicators
·       Time management; meeting deadlines
·       Quality of work
·       Anecdotal client and team feedback
·       Annual performance objectives and performance appraisal
 Salary: $100,000-$180,000
Virgo has included the base salary range or hourly rate for this role. Actual compensation offered within the range will depend upon, among other factors: a candidate’s skills, qualifications, and experience; actual ranges for current or former employees in the role; and market considerations.
Virgo is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability or protected veteran status.We make our careers website accessible to any and all users. If you need an accommodation to participate in the application process, please contact us at JobAppAccommodation@ipgdxtra.com. This email address is not for general employment inquiries or vendors; rather it is strictly for applicants who require special assistance accessing our employment website. Due to volume, messages sent to this email address that are not related to an accommodation cannot be answered.
